#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Substitute for Mustard Seed
#Text=Mustard seeds can be hard to find , which can be frustrating when you need them for a certain recipe .
#Text=Do n’t worry , there are several things you can use in place of mustard seeds , like horseradish , mayonnaise , and wasabi .
#Text=You can also substitute one kind of mustard seed for another , or use dry or prepared mustard in place of seeds .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Substituting with Other Ingredients
#Text=Use prepared horseradish to add spice .
#Text=Prepared horseradish is made by combining ground horseradish with vinegar , and sometimes other spices , to form a sauce .
#Text=You can get it from your local supermarket .
#Text=In place of mustard seed , use the same amount of prepared horseradish to add spice and complexity to your recipe .
#Text=Add mayonnaise to achieve the same consistency .
#Text=Mustard seeds are often used to thicken soups or other dishes .
#Text=If you need mustard seeds to change the consistency of a dish , substitute the seeds for the same amount of mayonnaise .
#Text=Substitute wasabi to increase the heat .
#Text=Wasabi is a spicy green paste used in many Asian dishes .
#Text=If you do n’t have mustard seed , substitute it with a smaller amount of wasabi to add heat to your dish .
#Text=Use caraway seeds for a similar flavor .
#Text=Substitute the same quantity of caraway seeds for mustard seeds in your recipe .
#Text=The flavors are similar and using one kind of seed in place of another ensures you do n’t have to alter your recipe any further .
#Text=Add turmeric to increase the nutritional value .
#Text=Turmeric reduces inflammation , relieves pain , and boosts immunity .
#Text=Substitute ground turmeric for mustard seed using a 1 to 1 ratio for added health benefits .
#Text=Using Different Kinds of Mustard
#Text=Substitute the same amount of dry mustard for mustard seeds .
#Text=If your recipe calls for 1 Tbsp ( 14.3 g ) of mustard seeds , simply substitute it for 1 Tbsp ( 14.3 g ) of dry mustard .
#Text=Use 1 tsp of prepared mustard instead of 1 Tbsp of mustard seeds .
#Text=If possible , decrease the amount of liquid in the recipe by 1 tsp ( 5 mL ) to compensate for this substitution .
#Text=For other quantities , use one-third of the amount of prepared mustard in place of mustard seed .
#Text=Replace white mustard seeds with fewer brown or black mustard seeds .
#Text=Brown and black mustard seeds are more potent than white ( also called yellow ) mustard seeds .
#Text=If your recipe calls for white mustard seeds , try using half the amount of brown or a quarter of the amount of black mustard seeds .
#Text=Use more yellow mustard seeds , or fewer black , in place of brown .
#Text=Brown mustard seeds are more flavorful than yellow but less intense than black mustard seeds .
#Text=Use twice as many yellow mustard seeds or half as many black mustard seeds .
#Text=Add more yellow or brown mustard seeds instead of using black .
#Text=Black mustard seeds are the most flavorful and spicy .
#Text=If you ca n’t find them , use four times as many white mustard seeds or twice as many brown mustard seeds in their place .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Start with a small amount of the substitution and taste the recipe .
#Text=Then , adjust the amount of the substitution as needed .
